alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:04AM EST until December 18 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Delaware County in central New York... Northern Sullivan County in central New York... Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1215 PM EST. * At 804 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Honesdale, Liberty, Walton, Deposit, Damascus, Neversink, Callicoon, Colchester, Waymart, Hancock, Jeffersonville, Prompton, Bethany, Starrucca, Peabrook, Stalker, Hankins, East Branch, Fishs Eddy and Equinunk. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
